intro: Mikania rubella, commonly known as creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Mikania rubella is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other climbing vines.
